action.action-desc: Mr. Gianforte introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To release certain wilderness study areas in the State of Montana.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protect Public Use of Public Lands Act.

section.header: Release of certain wilderness study areas in the State of Montana

subsection.text: Congress finds that, for the purposes of section 3(a) of the Montana Wilderness Study Act of 1977 (Public Law 95–150; 91 Stat. 1244), the land in the State of Montana described in subsection (c) has been adequately studied for wilderness designation.
The land described in subsection (c) is no longer subject to section 3(a) of the Montana Wilderness Study Act of 1977 (Public Law 95–150; 91 Stat. 1244).
The land referred to in subsections (a) and (b) is—

paragraph.text: the approximately 151,000 acres of land comprising the West Pioneer Wilderness Study Area;

the approximately 32,500 acres of land within the Blue Joint Wilderness Study Area not recommended for wilderness classification in the record of decision prepared by the Forest Service entitled Bitterroot National Forest Plan and dated September 1987;
the approximately 94,000 acres of land comprising the Sapphire Wilderness Study Area;
the approximately 81,000 acres of land comprising the Middle Fork Judith Wilderness Study Area; and
the approximately 91,000 acres of land comprising the Big Snowies Wilderness Study Area.
